TextBody:
Hello,

Thank you for contacting the Netwrix Support support team.

The resolution for this is to add the process "Outlook" to the whitelisted applications under "System Parameters" > "Advanced Scanning Exceptions".

	Please enable "Advanced Printer and MTP Scanning:".
	Add the word "Outlook" inside the box for "Application Process Name" then click on "Add to content".  The message "Apps successfully added to list!" will appear.  See below screenshots.
	The process "Outlook" will now be listed under "Whitelisted Applications"
	Select the process name and then click on "Generate", the message "App list successfully uploaded!" will appear as shown in the last screenshot below.
	Update the polices on the endpoint machine, close Outlook. Open Outlook again and re-test the scenario.












Please let me know if this resolved your issue or if you encountered any issues.


Best regards,
Alin Anca

Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix - DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd www.endpointprotector.com

Warm Regards

Hello,

Thank you for contacting the Netwrix Support support team.

The resolution for this is to add the process "Outlook" to the whitelisted applications under "System Parameters" > "Advanced Scanning Exceptions".

  1.  Please enable "Advanced Printer and MTP Scanning:".
  2.  Add the word "Outlook" inside the box for "Application Process Name" then click on "Add to content".  The message "Apps successfully added to list!" will appear.  See below screenshots.
  3.  The process "Outlook" will now be listed under "Whitelisted Applications"
  4.  Select the process name and then click on "Generate", the message "App list successfully uploaded!" will appear as shown in the last screenshot below.
  5.  Update the polices on the endpoint machine, close Outlook. Open Outlook again and re-test the scenario.

[cid:image001.png@01DB3447.124EAD30]




[cid:image002.png@01DB3447.124EAD30]


[cid:image003.png@01DB3447.124EAD30]

Please let me know if this resolved your issue or if you encountered any issues.


Best regards,
Alin Anca

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com<mailto:techsupport@netwrix.com>>
Sent: 11 November 2024 13:41
To: Matt Morrison <matt.morrison@nexus.org.uk<mailto:matt.morrison@nexus.org.uk>>
Subject: Since going up to EPP 6.2.3.1010 we have lost the ability to print from outlook [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0I9G6P:ref ]

Hello,

Thank you for contacting the Netwrix Support support team.

The resolution for this is to add the process "Outlook" to the whitelisted applications under "System Parameters" > "Advanced Scanning Exceptions".

  1.  Please enable "Advanced Printer and MTP Scanning:".
  2.  Add the word "Outlook" inside the box for "Application Process Name" then click on "Add to content".  The message "Apps successfully added to list!" will appear.  See below screenshots.
  3.  The process "Outlook" will now be listed under "Whitelisted Applications"
  4.  Select the process name and then click on "Generate", the message "App list successfully uploaded!" will appear as shown in the last screenshot below.
  5.  Update the polices on the endpoint machine, close Outlook. Open Outlook again and re-test the scenario.

[cid:image002.png@01DB34F6.9782EA20]




[cid:image003.png@01DB34F6.9782EA20]


[cid:image004.png@01DB34F6.9782EA20]

Please let me know if this resolved your issue or if you encountered any issues.


Best regards,
Alin Anca

Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix - DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd www.endpointprotector.com
